intro: Scolymocephalus ovatus, commonly known as the ovate scolymocephalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive ovate shape and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
